Which of the following phrases has a positive sentiment polarity? 
A) "To rain cats and dogs" 
B) "To be a piece of cake" 
C) "To kick the bucket" 
D) "To be under the weather" 
Hint: Think about the literal meanings of each phrase and how they are typically used in everyday language.

The phrase with a positive sentiment polarity is B) "To be a piece of cake." This phrase is typically used to describe something that is very easy to do, which conveys a positive sentiment. The other phrases, while they may be neutral or negative in sentiment, do not have the same positive connotation.
